page.title: 07Brenchley Parish Council.
page.content: The{P.C.}is the most localised form of{government.}It's size is determined by that of the{electorate.}Here{9 {members}represent about{2,000 electors who vote every{4 years. Councillors are members of the{community}such as tradesmen and farmers.They meet one evening every month to discuss and take decisions on local issues.The { {Chairman}is the{Queen's}representative in the Parish.{Examples of their work: Provided car park for the school.Help maintain Village Halls and footpath signs.Control the building of new houses.Prevent the unnecessary cutting down of trees.Look after the green,the pond and areas of woodland;a football pitch and horse ride have been made in {Cinderhill Wood.}Matfield{allotments are rented from the P.C.They organise the tidy village campaign with it's poster competition for the children.
